title: Example Module Overview
html: Modules extend ChaosCMS by adding new features that live inside /public/modules/. Each module has its own folder, usually with a main.php file to render content and an optional admin/ folder for back-end controls.

title: Basic Structure
html:
/public/modules/example/
  +-- main.php
  +-- admin/
  ¦    +-- admin.php
  +-- assets/
       +-- placeholder.png

The main.php file is what visitors see at /example. The optional admin/admin.php is what site admins see when they manage the module in the back end.

title: Core Guidelines
html:
• Keep everything inside the module folder (/public/modules/<slug>/).
  • Use require_once to load app/core/db.php if you need database access.
  • Use h() to safely escape user-facing output.
  • Optional: include meta.json to define name, version, and description.

title: Admin Integration
html: If your module has an admin/admin.php, the CMS will automatically detect it and show an Open Admin button in the admin ? modules panel.

title: Example Code
html:
<?php
// /public/modules/example/main.php
require_once __DIR__ . '/../../app/core/db.php';
$db = new \app\core\db();
$conn = $db->connect();

// Example output
?>
